name: Nashville, TN
tagline: Music City boom town—honky-tonks meet healthcare HQ in a sprawling, growing metro

diversity.summary: Nashville is about 27% Black, 10% Hispanic, with growing diversity. Reddit users report 'interracial couples aplenty' and generally accepting atmosphere. However, the city is politically divided—Davidson County (Nashville proper) is blue, but Tennessee is red, which creates tension. North Nashville is historically Black; south is predominantly white. Growing but still somewhat segregated.
diversity.notable: Reddit consensus: 'There are interracial couples aplenty' and 'culturally and ethnically diverse'

safety.summary: Nashville crime is moderate and varies by neighborhood. Some areas (Antioch, parts of North Nashville) have higher crime. Most popular neighborhoods (12 South, East Nashville, Germantown) are reasonably safe. Overall feels safe in the right areas but due diligence needed.

scenery.summary: Rolling hills, greenery, Cumberland River. Not dramatic but pleasant. Tennessee hills provide gentle topography. Lakes and parks nearby. About 1 hour to Land Between the Lakes, 3 hours to Smoky Mountains. Serviceable but not a scenic destination.

climate.summary: Mild winters with just occasional snow/ice, hot summers. If you want seasonal variety without brutal cold, Nashville delivers—real fall colors and spring blooms, but winter is manageable. Humidity is significant. Spring tornadoes are rare but real.

culture.summary: Nashville IS culture—live music everywhere (honky-tonks, indie venues, songwriter rounds), hot chicken, meat-and-threes, Broadway chaos, Ryman Auditorium, Grand Ole Opry. It's a legitimate cultural destination. Food scene is strong (Sean Brock's restaurants, hot chicken, BBQ, international). But the tourist boom can feel overwhelming, and the city is growing fast with 'bachelorette party' vibes downtown.

pros: Incredible music scene and cultural identity
Strong food culture (hot chicken, BBQ, fine dining)
Growing diversity and generally accepting of interracial couples
Energy and growth—feels alive and dynamic
cons: Growing FAST—traffic, costs rising, infrastructure struggling
Tennessee politics are very conservative (Nashville itself is blue island)
Crime in certain areas requires careful neighborhood selection
saturday: You wake up in East Nashville and walk to Barista Parlor for pour-over coffee in a converted transmission shop—peak Nashville. The morning is spent thrifting on Five Points, then you grab hot chicken at Prince's (the original, worth the wait). By afternoon, you're at the Nashville Farmers Market sampling local honey and fresh produce, then strolling the Shelby Bottoms Greenway. Evening brings live music at The Bluebird Cafe or a songwriter round at a dive bar—intimate performances that remind you why this city matters. Late dinner at Sadie's Mediterranean Kitchen, then you walk home through streets alive with music spilling from doorways. Nashville hustles, but it still knows how to play.

food_scene.summary: Nashville's food scene is a collision of Southern tradition and global ambition. Hot chicken is the local obsession, but the city also delivers James Beard-level fine dining, meat-and-threes (Southern comfort food cafeterias), and strong international options fueled by refugee communities.
mediterranean_options: International Market & Restaurant (Nashville Farmers Market—authentic Middle Eastern)
farmers_markets: Nashville Farmers Market (year-round, daily, with permanent vendors)
food_scene.food_culture: Nashville eats Southern-first (hot chicken, biscuits, BBQ, meat-and-threes), but the influx of transplants has brought diversity. Sean Brock's Audrey offers elevated Appalachian cuisine, while neighborhoods like The Nations and East Nashville spawn chef-driven concepts weekly. It's a city that loves eating out.
food_scene.grocery_quality: Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, The Turnip Truck (local co-op), Fresh Market. Solid grocery access though not as international as larger metros.

neighborhoods.name: East Nashville (Five Points)
neighborhoods.vibe: Hipster haven—dive bars, vintage shops, murals, eclectic
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Most walkable, artistic vibe, diverse. Gentrification tensions but authentic character. Great for exploring.

neighborhoods.name: 12 South
neighborhoods.vibe: Trendy, Instagram-worthy—boutiques, brunch spots, upscale residential
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Walkable, safe, cute neighborhood. Can feel polished/manufactured. Good restaurants. Less diversity.

neighborhoods.name: Germantown
neighborhoods.vibe: Historic neighborhood turned upscale—cobblestones, new restaurants
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Walkable, near downtown, historic charm. Expensive. Close to action but quieter than Broadway.

neighborhoods.name: Sylvan Park
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Safe, affordable, neighborhood feel. Less walkable. Good for settling in vs adventure.

neighborhoods.name: The Gulch
neighborhoods.vibe: Urban renewal—high-rises, rooftop bars, walkable but touristy
neighborhoods.why_for_them: Most walkable, modern amenities. Expensive. Can feel generic/touristy. Close to everything but lacks soul.
